turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I'm so frustrated! I keep getting denials on these AR claims. What's going on?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. To help me investigate, could you provide me with some specific claim examples? Claim numbers and patient names would be helpful.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, here are a few: Claim #12345 for John Doe, Claim #67890 for Jane Smith, and Claim #13579 for Robert Jones. All denied within the last week.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. Let me check the denial codes for those claims. One moment... Okay, it looks like claims #12345 and #67890 were denied due to 'Lack of Prior Authorization'. Claim #13579 was denied for 'Non-Covered Service'.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, 'Lack of Prior Authorization' again? I thought we submitted those! Is there any way to find out when these authorizations were requested, and the status?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Yes, let me access the authorization portal. For John Doe (claim #12345), the authorization request was submitted on 2024-01-15 and is currently listed as 'Pending'. For Jane Smith (claim #67890), the authorization request was submitted on 2024-01-10 and was 'Denied' on 2024-01-12 due to missing documentation.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Missing documentation? Seriously? Okay, this is ridiculous. Why aren't we notified of these things more promptly? And what documentation was missing?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your concern. The system indicates that a notification was sent to the specified email address, but I can certainly check the settings to make sure notifications are enabled correctly. Regarding the missing documentation for Jane Smith, it appears the insurance company required additional clinical notes to support the medical necessity of the procedure. I can provide you with a link to the specific guidelines from the insurance provider if you'd like.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, please send me that link. And thank you for finally giving me some concrete information. This is actually helpful!
